lexUnit.name: bucket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical open container with a handle, used to carry liquids.

sentence.text: Her owner rushed to bring her a bucket of oats before she should become entangled in the fence once again .
Buckets of beer circulate to encourage the men ( the pubs are open all day ) and the atmosphere is quite convivial by now .
The woman did n't remove her arms from the curd , only nodded at her son and then at the bucket of peelings .
He was an English King , and his great rival was France , and , in order to taunt King Henry , the Dauphin of France sent him a bucket of tennis balls . "
He brought her a silver bucket of ice cubes with the glimmer of a flourish .
There are three buckets of long-hardened pitch , and a metal bucket with a hinged lid .
Beneath each window were long encrusted brown stains , stretching to the ground , where the monks over the centuries had emptied their latrine buckets .
Two men got the Lewis gun to the rim of the crater , but were taken by a storm of bullets as they slowed to drag the clumsy ammunition bucket .
The ground crew were waiting , armed with axes , pickhandles , fire-extinguishers , metal-cutters , buckets of sand .
Some boys were bringing battered wooden buckets up from the well and the occasional housewife emptied the slops from the night jars out into the middle of the street .
A waiter wound through the tables towards them , bringing an ice bucket with a bobbing bottle and two chilled glasses .
He had asked for , and eventually been given , a plastic bucket of cold water and a sponge .
Men who had emptied their slop buckets were returning to their cells .
The man carried a mop and a bucket of soapy disinfectant and he was looking at Henry as if he 'd crawled out from under a stone .
Water was carried in leather buckets from the spring along by the castle , a quarter of a mile down the track .
This meant carrying buckets of near boiling water a distance of eighteen to twenty feet , and emptying meant doing the job all over again in the reverse direction .
I liked her from the moment I met her , and I well recall the occasion -- I had turned up at their place and she appeared in the yard from the shed carrying buckets of milk .
He left the bank after he was refused access to his file and returned carrying a bucket of petrol and a cigarette lighter .
